intro: Pavonia schrankii var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble petals, which are actually modified leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its foliage is lance-shaped and has a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
